intro: Paederia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered paederia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and quinine. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Paederia densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
